meanings.definition: Not governed by or according to reason; illogical.
meanings.sent1: The alogical decision to wear shorts in the snow left him shivering.
meanings.sent2: Her alogical explanation for being late was that her alarm clock didn't go off.
meanings.sent3: It was alogical to think that eating ice cream for breakfast would make her taller.
meanings.sent4: The alogical maze of emotions in his mind made it hard for him to focus.
meanings.sent5: The alogical behavior of the cat chasing its own tail amused the children.

meanings.sent1: The alogical puzzle had pieces that didn't fit together no matter how hard he tried.
meanings.sent2: His alogical argument made no sense to anyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: It was alogical to believe that wearing mismatched socks would bring good luck.
meanings.sent4: The alogical pattern of stars in the sky seemed to form a mysterious message.
meanings.sent5: The alogical plot of the movie confused the audience and left them scratching their heads.
